shipping_documentation_guide.title: Shipping Document Processing: The Technical Guide for Freight Operations

expert_sections.title: Bill of Lading Field Mapping: Source Document to TMS/ERP
expert_sections.content: Bill of Lading (BOL) documents contain critical shipment data that must be accurately extracted and mapped to your transportation management and ERP systems. DocStandard standardizes the following key fields:

mapping_data.normalization_logic: Parse company name from address block; Standardize address format (street, city, state, ZIP); Match against existing vendor database.
Extract consignee details; Validate address against USPS database; Link to customer account by name or address match.
Extract alphanumeric identifier; Validate format (typically 8-12 characters); Flag duplicates for review.
Parse line items (LTL, FTL, Fuel Surcharge, etc.); Map charge types to GL codes; Calculate total vs. line item sum.
Extract weight (convert to consistent unit: lbs or kg); Parse dimensions (LxWxH); Calculate cube; Extract pallet count.
Standardize date format (MM/DD/YYYY); Validate date ranges (pickup before delivery); Flag future dates or past-due shipments.
Extract product descriptions; Map to internal SKU codes when available; Classify by commodity type (hazmat, temperature-controlled, etc.).
Extract special handling codes (Liftgate, Inside Delivery, Appointment Required); Flag hazmat or temperature requirements.

expert_sections.title: Airway Bill (AWB) Processing for Air Freight
expert_sections.content:
Airway Bills require specialized handling due to international shipping regulations and IATA standards. DocStandard processes:

- **Master vs. House AWB:** Distinguishes between carrier-issued master AWBs and forwarder-issued house AWBs, maintaining proper linkage.
- **IATA Airport Codes:** Validates and standardizes 3-letter airport codes (e.g., LAX, JFK, LHR) for origin and destination.
- **Weight & Volume:** Extracts chargeable weight (the greater of actual weight or volumetric weight) for accurate freight calculations.
- **Customs Declarations:** Captures declared value, commodity codes, and country of origin for customs clearance preparation.
- **Service Level Codes:** Maps service types (Express, Standard, Economy) to internal service classifications.

This ensures air freight documentation integrates seamlessly with your logistics systems and customs workflows.

expert_sections.title: Container Tracking and Documentation
expert_sections.content:
Container shipments require tracking multiple data points across the shipment lifecycle:

1. **Container Numbers:** Extract and validate ISO container numbers (11 characters: 4-letter prefix + 6 digits + 1 check digit).
2. **Seal Numbers:** Capture seal numbers for security and customs verification.
3. **Vessel/Voyage Information:** Extract vessel name, voyage number, and port rotation for ocean freight tracking.
4. **Port Codes:** Standardize port names to UN/LOCODE format (5 characters: 2-letter country + 3-letter location).
5. **Equipment Type:** Classify containers (20ft, 40ft, 40ft HC, refrigerated, etc.) for capacity planning.
6. **Gate In/Out Dates:** Track container movement through terminal gates for detention/demurrage calculations.

DocStandard maintains complete container documentation chains, linking BOLs, packing lists, and customs documents to enable end-to-end visibility.

expert_sections.title: Multi-Modal Shipment Coordination
expert_sections.content:
Complex shipments often involve multiple transportation modes (truck → rail → ocean → truck). DocStandard handles:

- **Intermodal Linkage:** Connects truck BOLs to rail waybills to ocean bills of lading, maintaining shipment continuity.
- **Transit Time Calculation:** Tracks time-in-transit across modes to identify bottlenecks and optimize routing.
- **Cost Allocation:** Splits freight charges across modes for accurate cost accounting and customer billing.
- **Exception Management:** Flags missing documents, date mismatches, or routing inconsistencies that could cause delays.

This coordination ensures your TMS has complete visibility into multi-leg shipments, preventing lost shipments and billing errors.

expert_sections.title: ROI Analysis: Freight Documentation Value
expert_sections.content: Standard BOL/AWB data prep takes 10 minutes per shipment. We reduce this to 15 seconds per document, delivering ~$110k in annual reclaimed capacity.
